item.title: Those Dirty Dogs
item.description: Those Dirty Dogs is a 1973 Italian-Spanish Spaghetti Western film written and directed by Giuseppe Rosati and starring Gianni Garko and Stephen Boyd. The film was made in the later part of the spaghetti western boom. As such it features such latter-day genre elements as self-parody, guffaw humour, near-slapstick fight scenes, machine guns hidden in everyday household items, and bombastic villains.

item.title: All'ombra di una colt
item.description: In a Colt's Shadow is a 1965 Italian spaghetti western film directed and written by Giovanni Grimaldi.

item.title: John the Bastard
item.description: John the Bastard is a 1967 Italian Spaghetti Western film written and directed by Armando Crispino and starring John Richardson.

item.title: Bury Them Deep
item.description: Bury Them Deep is a 1968 Italian Spaghetti Western film written and directed by Paolo Moffa and starring Craig Hill.

item.title: The Texican
item.description: The Texican is a Technicolor 1966 Techniscope film produced and written by John C. Champion and directed by Lesley Selander. It is a paella western remake of their 1948 film Panhandle adapted for the persona of Audie Murphy that featured Broderick Crawford as the heavy. The film was retitled Ringo il Texano in Italy to coincide with the popularity of the Ringo spaghetti western film series.

item.title: Per il gusto di uccidere
item.description: Per il gusto di uccidere is the 1966 Italian Spaghetti Western film debut directed by Tonino Valerii. It is also the first film to use the camera system known as 2P. It was filmed in Almería. It is produced by Francesco Genesi, Vincenzo Genesi, Daniele Senatore, Stefano Melpignano and Jose Lopez Moreno, scored by Nico Massi and edited by Rosa G. Salgado.

item.title: I Want Him Dead
item.description: I Want Him Dead is a 1968 Italian-Spanish Spaghetti Western film directed by Paolo Bianchini and starring Craig Hill.

item.title: Vier Teufelskerle
item.description: Vier Teufelskerle ist ein Italowestern aus der Spätphase des Genres, den Giuseppe Rosati inszenierte. Die deutschsprachige Erstaufführung war am 18. April 1974.

item.title: Pistoleros
item.description: Pistoleros ist ein italienisch-spanischer Italowestern aus der Frühphase des Genres, der unter der Regie von Gianni Grimaldi entstand und am 7. Oktober 1966 in die bundesdeutschen Kinos kam.

item.title: John il bastardo
item.description: John il bastardo ist ein Italowestern aus dem Jahr 1967, der unter der Debüt-Regie von Armando Crispino mit John Richardson in der Hauptrolle entstand. Eine Aufführung im deutschsprachigen Raum fand nicht statt.
